message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The irregular borders and the discohesive cell growth into the epidermis suggest that the most likely diagnosis is superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma has a nodular growth pattern, Lentigo melanoma occurs on sun-damaged skin, and Desmoplastic melanoma has a fibrotic appearance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The clinical presentation of a progressively enlarging lesion with irregular borders is suggestive of melanoma. The pathology findings of abnormal melanocytes forming nests at the dermo-epidermal junction and discohesive cell growth into the epidermis are consistent with superficial spreading melanoma, which is the most common type of melanoma. Nodular melanoma typically presents as a new, rapidly growing pigmented nodule, while lentigo melanoma arises from a preexisting lentigo maligna lesion and often has tan-to-black color variation on sun-damaged skin. Desmoplastic melanoma is a rare type of melanoma with a fibrous, desmoplastic stroma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The irregular borders and discohesive cell growth into the epidermis suggest that the most likely diagnosis is Superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma usually has a uniform color and Lentigo melanoma usually occurs on sun-damaged skin. Desmoplastic melanoma has a dense fibrotic stroma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The irregular borders and abnormal melanocytes forming nests at the dermo-epidermal junction suggest superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma is raised and usually uniformly colored, lentigo melanoma is a flat and irregular in shape and Desmoplastic melanoma has a fibrous/hard texture.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The features of the lesion suggest that it is a superficial spreading melanoma, which is the most common type of melanoma. Nodular melanoma tends to rapidly progress and Lentigo melanoma is often found in older persons with prolonged sun exposure. Desmoplastic melanoma has a unique histological appearance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the lesion with irregular borders and abnormal melanocytes forming nests at the dermo-epidermal junction and discohesive cell growth into the epidermis fit the criteria for superficial spreading melanoma, which is the most common type of melanoma. Nodular melanoma is usually raised and uniformly pigmented. Lentigo melanoma is usually flat and the color is brown or black. Desmoplastic melanoma has a fibrous, scar-like appearance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The irregular borders and abnormal melanocytes forming nests at the dermo-epidermal junction and discohesive cell growth into the epidermis are characteristics of superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma typically presents as a raised, well-defined lesion, and Lentigo melanoma typically presents as a flat, tan or brown lesion. Desmoplastic melanoma presents as a firm, pink, or flesh-colored nodule.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristic features of the lesion described are consistent with superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma often has a elevated, dome-shaped appearance and desmoplastic melanoma has a fibrous component. Lentigo melanoma is less common and often arises from pre-existing lentigo maligna.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The irregular borders and abnormal melanocytes with discohesive cell growth into the epidermis suggest a superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma usually presents as a dome-shaped lesion, Lentigo melanoma usually presents on sun-exposed areas, and desmoplastic melanoma usually presents as a firm, flesh-colored or pink nodule.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the lesion, such as irregular borders and abnormal melanocytes forming nests at the dermo-epidermal junction, suggest that it is a superficial spreading melanoma. Nodular melanoma is typically elevated and has a smooth surface, while lentigo melanoma and desmoplastic melanoma have different growth patterns and clinical presentations.
